;Fain acknowledged the symbolism of Biden's visit to the picket line, the first time a sitting President had done so. “这是一个历史性的时刻，”他说。 “但重要的是政府如何推动这一转变。”我问美国汽车工人联合会是否会支持拜登。 “我们的支持将不再是自由给予的，”费恩说。 “他们会被赚到的。” He worries that if electric-vehicle manufacturing becomes another low-wage, low-benefit carve-out, Democrats in the Rust Belt will see a repeat of 2016. “Trump's saying what our members are experiencing,” he said.

;

;At the same time, Fain vehemently denounced Trump, drawing a connection between the migrants at the heart of the current border crisis and his own ancestors. “我看着那些特朗普喜欢称之为强奸犯、小偷或毒贩的贫困人口，”他说。 “他们和我一样。他们和我的家人没有什么不同。”尽管他担心工人会被排除在绿色转型之外，但他对包括特朗普在内的共和党政客缺乏耐心，他们指责这是在迎合自由派。费恩指出，他心目中的英雄之一鲁瑟是环保主义的早期支持者。这是他对联盟的广泛政治愿景的一部分。他不顾美国主要汽车公司的反对，游说《清洁空气法案》，并为 1970 年第一个地球日写了第一张支票，美国汽车工人联合会成为该法案的最大捐助者。 He once asked, “What good is another week's vacation if the lake you used to go to is polluted and you can't swim in it and your kids can't play in it?”

;

;Walter Reuther was born in 1907 in Wheeling, West Virginia.他的父亲瓦伦丁是一名工会组织者，开着一辆啤酒马车，以​​社会党的名义竞选州立法机构议员。 1919 年，当尤金·德布斯 (Eugene Debs) 在西弗吉尼亚州的监狱里时，瓦伦丁带着沃尔特去见他。 （德布斯因反对美国参与第一次世界大战而被判违反《间谍法》。）沃尔特也成为一名社会主义者，高中辍学，开始在惠灵钢铁公司担任工具和模具制造学徒。 （一个四百磅重的骰子落在他的脚上，导致他的脚趾受伤。）后来他搬到了底特律，那里的工资更高，并在福特工厂找到了一份工作，同时就读于后来的韦恩州立大学。 1932 年，鲁瑟离开福特，声称自己因政治活动而被迫离开。他取出一大笔积蓄，和弟弟维克多一起去了欧洲。他们主要骑自行车穿越了十个国家，最后到达苏联，在一家新汽车工厂工作了一年半。 The food was unfamiliar—each brother lost about twenty pounds—but Walter found the atmosphere in the plant's cafeteria “absorbing,” and praised “the wonderful spirit” found among the workers, who sometimes strummed guitars and danced at lunch.

;

;Reuther returned to Detroit in 1935, the year Roosevelt signed the Wagner Act, which guaranteed the right to collectively bargain—and to strike.当时，汽车工厂的条件十分恶劣。在热浪期间，数百名汽车工人死于密歇根州的工厂。汽车工人平均年收入九百美元；政府估计，一个四口之家至少需要近两倍才能生存。 Meanwhile, General Motors was employing a Ku Klux Klan offshoot called the Black Legion to break up union-organizing efforts.

;;

;In 1936, Reuther was elected as a delegate for the UAW He became president of Local 174, where he presided over a dramatic expansion of the union's membership.他参加了弗林特静坐罢工，这是一场为期四十四天的暴力战斗，导致通用汽车成立工会。克莱斯勒也采用了类似的策略成立工会。在立交桥之战中，UAW 组织者在迪尔伯恩一家装配厂外遭到亨利·福特的私人保安的野蛮殴打，鲁瑟的脸部被踢了一脚，并被扔下了两段楼梯。 Finally, in 1941, after a ten-day strike, the union succeeded in organizing Ford, too.

;
;
;

;During the Second World War, with factories running around the clock, there was a tremendous demand for workers.数十万黑人和白人移民到这座城市，尤其是来自南方的人。 1941 年 6 月，罗斯福发布了一项行政命令，禁止国防工业中的歧视性就业做法，这是自重建以来的第一个总统民权命令。白人工人有时会受到管理层的煽动，以所谓的仇恨罢工来回应——1943年，帕卡德公司将三名黑人提拔到飞机装配线后，有两万五千人罢工。时任美国汽车工人联合会主席 R·J·托马斯 (R. J. Thomas) 暂停了 30 名罢工头目的职务，并在政府机构的帮助下，让其余罢工者重返工作岗位。 “我们不会撤退，”托马斯说。 “If we take any other position, our organization is lost.”

;

;Reuther was elected president of the UAW in 1946. In a speech that year, he argued that the labor movement should not focus solely on economic gains for its members but instead must “fight for the welfare of the public at large.”两年后，一名杀手差点在他的厨房里刺杀了他。此后，他的名气越来越大。有人猜测他将竞选美国总统。他的社会民主愿景涵盖了多种事业——核裁军、环保主义，尤其是公民权利。 1963 年，当马丁·路德·金和其他数十名示威者在伯明翰被捕时，鲁瑟派了两名代表携带十六万美元现金将他们保释。 He was the only prominently featured white speaker at the March on Washington.

;

;In 1970, Reuther died in a plane crash en route to Black Lake, Michigan, where he was building a thousand-acre labor-education retreat.不久之后，未受过大学教育的工人的实际工资开始下降。石油冲击、放松管制、高利率和全球化越来越多地将工业就业岗位首先转移到非工会的南方，然后转移到低工资的外国国家。 By that point, the UAW's membership had peaked, at one and a half million.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The UAW got weaker.费恩将这种下滑的部分原因归咎于“联合计划”的创建——他认为这破坏了工会的独立性。 Fain 所称的“公司工会主义”长达 40 年，导致了一系列不良合同，并为 2017 年联邦调查后爆发的腐败丑闻奠定了基础，并导致 2021 年 17 人被定罪，其中包括两名前 UAW 主席和三位前克莱斯勒高管。这些高管向美国汽车工人联合会官员行贿超过三百五十万美元，其中部分是通过该公司位于底特律的联合培训中心之一发行的信用卡进行的。工会官员还花费了超过一百万美元的会员钱来购买高尔夫球、牛排晚餐、雪茄和酒。今年早些时候，费恩以微弱优势赢得了美国汽车工人联合会主席职位，他承诺让工会恢复鲁瑟时代的战斗精神。 (The UAW is still under a court-appointed monitor.)

;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Today, the union has three hundred and eighty thousand active members;不到一半的人受雇于三巨头。 （七十年代，美国汽车工人联合会在韦恩州立大学组织了行政人员；超过四分之一的工会成员现在在高等教育机构工作。）累积的麻烦迫使费恩对当前的谈判采取积极的态度——他需要这笔交易足以吸引新兴电动汽车行业的工人，而该行业的许多竞争对手，包括丰田和特斯拉，都没有加入工会。费恩告诉我，非工会职位与三巨头提供的许多职位没有什么区别。 He added, “It's hard to grow a movement when people can't see the difference.”

;

;Two weeks into the strike, the kitchen at Local 12 was buzzing.多丽丝·琼斯和几个助手正在做一百份早餐，准备带到纠察线上。琼斯今年五十五岁，留着长辫子，他把几加仑的鸡蛋倒在一堆火鸡香肠旁边的煎锅上。自从罢工开始以来，她每天早上六点就到达大厅，一直呆到午夜，有时甚至更晚。 “我是一颗二十四小时的定时炸弹，”她告诉我。她在吉普车工厂工作了二十多年。罢工前不久，她在工厂周围放置了箱子，为工会的食品储藏室筹集捐款。 It was now stacked with diapers, one of the most coveted commodities, and with packaged food, including rice and instant mashed potatoes, which she gave to any member who came in, along with whatever fresh food—plums, peaches—she could get hold of.

;

;Twenty-four years ago, Jones was in nursing school in Toledo when a counsellor offered her an application for a position at the Chrysler Jeep plant.两周后，她在车身修理厂工作。 “我用焊枪连接挡泥板、引擎盖、车门等东西，”她告诉我。 “我的头发、我的身体、我的衣服都被烧伤了，我会哭着回家。我说：“我不会回去。” But as the days went by I knew I had a good job, enough money to take care of my family.”

;
;;
;

;Jones, the team leader of the Gladiator right-side-door line, has a maternal relationship to her co-workers, who call her Mama D. She earns about thirty-three dollars an hour, and in six years will be eligible for a pension.她的几位家人也曾在这家工厂工作过，其中包括她的三个儿子之一，他是一名补充员工，收入只有母亲的一半。 He told me, of the strike, “It's hurting a lot of people who need the money.”

;

;By late September, the number of people coming into the food pantry had increased.工厂罢工导致整个供应链陷入困境，导致其他工厂数千人失业。这些工人没有从工会获得每周五百美元的罢工工资，尽管他们可以申请失业保险，在俄亥俄州，失业保险是工人平均周工资的一半。有一天，当我离开食品储藏室时，一位戴着有色眼镜的中年黑人妇女走进来。她是克莱斯勒一家供应商的员工，该供应商因罢工而关闭，她仍在等待第一笔失业救济金。她把自己的名字写在账本上，琼斯递给她一袋食物。 “I'm very, very thankful,” the woman said quietly, as she slipped out the door.

;

;Marcy Kaptur, the Democratic representative for Ohio's Ninth District, which includes part of Toledo, describes herself as a “daughter of the UAW” Her mother, who worked at Champion, the spark-plug company, was on the union's first organizing committee there;她的父亲在吉普车工厂工作了十年。她认为，这次罢工是历史性的。 “The conditions have become so untenable in these plants,” she said.

;

;In the early nineties, in the House of Representatives, Kaptur led the fight against ;NAFTA;, which nonetheless passed, 234–200.这是一项两党共同通过的法案；一百零二名民主党人和一百三十二名共和党人支持它。卡普图尔说，投票当晚，企业游说者获得了筹款委员会的一个房间作为临时总部，以在最后一刻争取支持。有一次，她看到即将当选美国劳工联合会-产联主席的约翰·斯威尼 (John Sweeney) 从国会大厦的侧门进来。没有人注意他。 He held his raincoat over his arm, and walked up the stairs to the gallery, alone.

;
;
;

;After ;NAFTA; passed, Kaptur visited the ;maquiladoras;, mostly electronics and car-part factories just south of the US-Mexico border.那里的工人没有独立的工会，每小时的收入只有一美元。她说，他们中的许多人住在“硬纸棚屋里，如果你可以这样称呼它们的话”，而且没有淡水。 “我支持自由人民之间的自由贸易，”她继续说道。 “当人们不自由时，他们就会受到自己政府的剥削。” She blamed ;NAFTA; for other deleterious outcomes, such as allowing American agribusinesses to flood Mexico with cheap corn, wiping out much of the country's subsistence farming.研究估计，约 200 万墨西哥农民因此失去了生计。他们中的许多人移民到了美国； others stayed behind and replaced corn with opium poppies, for producing heroin.

;

;The over-all national income is higher in the United States with free trade, but the majority of people are worse off.根据经济政策研究所的乔什·比文斯 (Josh Bivens) 的研究，与低工资国家的贸易使没有大学学位的美国工人（大约占人口的 60%）每年损失 2300 美元的工资，即使在考虑了消费品价格较低。自1998年以来，美国已经失去了七万多家工厂和五百万个制造业工作岗位，其中许多位于铁锈地带。在乔治城大学教授工人阶级研究的雪莉·李·林肯（Sherry Lee Linkon）创造了“去工业化的半衰期”一词来描述工厂和工厂关闭的连锁反应如何持续几代人。上个月，普林斯顿大学经济学家安妮·凯斯和安格斯·迪顿发表的新研究显示，没有大学学位的美国人的预期寿命在 2010 年左右达到顶峰，此后一直在下降。 By 2021, not having graduated from college meant eight and a half fewer years of life.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;;;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Bill Clinton and Barack Obama each won Ohio twice, but neither arrested the economic decline of the state's working class, which is particularly acute in the traditionally Democratic northern corridor. (During Obama's first Presidential campaign, he called ;NAFTA; “devastating” and “a big mistake”; in office, he pushed for the Trans-Pacific Partnership, a free-trade deal with eleven countries.) “As deindustrialization occurred, especially in steel-making places like Youngstown, those areas became increasingly redder,” John Russo, an emeritus professor of working-class studies at Youngstown State University, told me. “其原因与其他原因一样，是民主党无法——或不愿——保护这些地方免受正在发生的事情的影响。”卡普图尔认为，特朗普抓住了这个机会。 “他就像旋转木马上的最后一个铜环，”她说。 “He expresses, in his rather demented way, the angst that people feel, the uncertainty that people feel—and he expresses their rage.”

;

;The Democrats, meanwhile, are in thrall to the coasts. （该党众议院领导人均来自沿海各州。）“我们必须为国家的这一地区拼尽全力，因为我们被忽视了，”卡普图尔说。她指出，美国铁路公司最近的拨款中“没有任何”用于中西部铁路的拨款，以及用于东北走廊的 120 亿美元拨款。 2021年，俄亥俄州立法机构的共和党人重新划定了她的选区，将更多保守派选区纳入其中，明显是为了驱逐她，但她却出乎意料地再次当选。这一胜利，以及同样强烈反对自由贸易协定的参议员谢罗德·布朗的胜利，反映了这个问题的突出性。卡普图尔对 2024 年及以后的情况感到担忧。 “民主党非常幸运，党内有许多受过教育的人，”她说。 “But, when you start losing the working people of America, you're in big trouble—and they are.”

;

;A recent New York ;Times;/Siena poll showed Biden slipping badly with working-class voters of all races;他在非白人、未受过大学教育的选民中的领先优势已从 2020 年的 48 个百分点降至 16 个百分点。与此同时，UAW 罢工已成为有抱负的右翼民粹主义者的轰动事件。 9月，共和党参议员乔什·霍利(Josh Hawley)加入了密苏里州温茨维尔的通用汽车纠察线，尽管他之前支持工作权法案，该法案将削弱该州工会的财政和议价能力。不久之后，曾从事风险投资工作的共和党参议员 JD 万斯 (JD Vance) 也加入了卡普图尔的吉普纠察线。 “第一次来这里？” she asked him.

;

;The union's stand-up-strike strategy is paying off. In late September, minutes before a 10 ;AM; deadline at which more plants would go offline, Stellantis agreed to reinstate its cost-of-living adjustment.在美国汽车工人联合会威胁要罢工通用汽车一家生产凯迪拉克 SUV 的利润丰厚的工厂后，该公司承诺将新的电池工厂纳入与工会的主协议之下。 （后来，那家工厂还是举行了罢工。）“我们被告知，电动汽车的未来必须是一场逐底竞争，”身穿“Eat the Rich”T恤的费恩在视频公告中说道。 “现在我们揭穿了他们的虚张声势。” By late October, he had expanded the strike to include more than forty-five thousand workers across twenty-two states, and the most profitable facilities for each of the three automakers.

;

;Then came the breakthrough: the tentative agreement with Ford.费恩指示他的成员返回工作岗位，以便该公司能够尽快重新开始制造和销售汽车，这将进一步迫使通用汽车和 Stellantis 达成和解。 According to the Anderson Economic Group, the Big Three have lost more than four billion dollars since the strike began.

;

;The economic pain has also been deepening for the workers still on strike.在底特律与车队交谈后，费恩参观了托莱多的吉普车纠察队。他受到了热烈的欢迎，但也引起了怀疑。 “你认为我们还要等多久才能开始挣扎？”一名抱着小女儿的工人问道。另一位说：“我们中的一些人已经在挣扎了。比如，这是一场讨论吗？” （对于大多数工人来说，罢工工资还不到每周工资的一半。）费恩点点头。 “这很糟糕，”他说。 “我们不想呆在这里。但最终公司把我们置于这样的境地。这是一个选择：我们罢工吗？ Or do we continue to go backward?”

;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;When Fain left, I drove to Local 12, past a number of vacant, grassy lots, remnants of former factories.托莱多的状况似乎比我待过的其他铁锈地带城市（拉辛、扬斯敦、鲁日河）要好一些，但空虚感令人不安。美国对其工业基础的破坏比其他西方国家更为严重。鉴于民主党和共和党都参与了破坏，政治后果难以预测。我遇到的许多工人似乎对即将到来的总统竞选持距离和愤世嫉俗的态度。 They were more animated by the visceral, immediate politics of the strike.

;
;
;

;By the time I got back to the hall, it was getting dark.我看到琼斯在周围忙碌。这又是漫长的一天。她看起来很疲惫，但也很满足。有人捐赠了几盘炸鸡，她要去纠察队去送。我们走到她的白色吉普车前，她打开后门。味道很诱人，她坚持要我拿一块。我问她对费恩的来访有何看法。她缓慢而从容地回答。 “他说的是实话，”她说。门线工作人员对罢工的焦虑情绪不断上升，但费恩设法安抚了他们。 “我看到他们在听他说的话时更加放松了，”她说。 “他向他们保证，他们会变得很棒。”她关上门，挥手告别，然后开车回到队列。 ♦

;My grandmother, who is ninety-two, has moved three times in her life.她出生在中国山东省的一个小镇，二十三岁时乘船来到上海。当她六十三岁时，她搬到了澳大利亚悉尼——我出生的地方——然后，当她八十五岁时，与我和母亲一起来到了纽约。这些地方有一些相似之处：这三个城市都是港口城市——人口众多，但不是首都——都因东海岸的贸易而发展壮大。 Another constant in her life, at least in the past twenty or so years, has been the Austrian police-procedural television show “Inspector Rex,” which is about a crime-fighting dog.

;

;“Rex” débuted in 1994, the year I was born, and ran for eighteen seasons over the course of twenty-one years.标准剧集时长四十五分钟，讲述了一只名叫雷克斯的狗的故事，它是维也纳一个凶杀组的成员。 （该剧最初是用德语拍摄的。）雷克斯的同事包括一名首席侦探，每三到四个季度就会更换一次；一位热心的代表；还有一个呆在车站的笨手笨脚的第三个人。该剧据称是一部家庭节目，融合了九十年代的真挚情感——其中有一个流传甚广的笑话，其中雷克斯找到了从一位小侦探那里偷走火腿卷的新方法——偶尔还有一些令人毛骨悚然的华丽表演。人们被毒杀、被刺伤、被从博物馆的阳台上扔下来、被大扳手敲打头部。在一个典型的情节中，首席侦探莫泽调查了一起谋杀案，其中一名妇女被催眠刺伤了她的男朋友。 As the villain is about to kill Moser with a motorbike, Rex launches out of a bush and tackles him.

;

;My grandmother is a big fan of the show, and many people around the world evidently share her disposition.它在其祖国奥地利和德国、整个欧洲以及澳大利亚都非常受欢迎，并在澳大利亚的黄金时段在政府资助的多元文化广播公司特别广播服务上播出。 When “Rex” was cancelled by its Austrian channel after ten years, in 2004, the Italian national broadcaster, ;RAI;, bought the rights and moved Rex to Rome, such was the nation's love for the dog.现在，他在维也纳的街道上，与一位名叫法布里（Fabbri）的英俊的意大利新人类伴侣一起沿着纳沃纳广场的海王星喷泉嬉戏。 The show has also been remade in Poland (“Komisarz Alex”), Portugal (“Inspetor Max”), Lithuania (“Inspektorius Mažylis”), Slovakia (“Rex”), and Canada (“Hudson & Rex”).

;

;This level of intercontinental popularity can be attributed to two factors.一是该剧可靠的本周反派结构。第二个是它的明星——一只庄严的德国牧羊犬，它明显地具有超越语言的聪明才智。我在澳大利亚上学时正值一种霸王龙狂热时期。我记得有关宠物主人如何为他们的狗播放节目的新闻报道，它们会在屏幕上吠叫并高兴地摇尾巴。据报道，德国教皇本笃十六世也是一名粉丝，并与他的兄弟格奥尔格一起观看了这部影片，格奥尔格自称是来自巴伐利亚雷根斯堡市的一名男子的朋友，该男子拥有一只扮演雷克斯的狗。我们没有狗。在我们家里，这个节目是为我的祖母和我自己准备的。母亲独自抚养我长大，有时工作到很晚。照顾我成了祖母的责任，在某种程度上，反之亦然。 Many nights, we would watch “Rex” together while we waited for my mother to come home.

;

;For an elderly woman originally from Shandong, then naturalized in Shanghai, a mostly kinetic show in German about a charismatic, industrious dog was perfect.与我不同，她看不懂英文字幕。但没有人认为这很重要。在《雷克斯》中，我和我的祖母有着一种纯粹的易读性，他无言地告诉我们他在做什么。 (The plots, of course, were finagled so that each case could be solved by something a dog could do.) My grandmother watched with a rather flat affect—the humans sparked very little reaction from her, but when the dog appeared she would always point and make sure I was watching, and remark to me or herself about how smart dogs are.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;There is a phrase we like to say to each other when we watch “Inspector Rex.”这是上海话的一种结构，其优雅和力量只能被翻译成英语。这是四个字，或者更准确地说，是字符。用简体字写，就是狗出来了； transcribed phonetically, in our accent, it's something like ;Gou tse leh le;. Literally, it means “The dog [;gou;] has come out [;tse leh le;].” Parsed into more fluid English, you'd say, “The dog is here,” or, most perfectly, something like “There he is.”

;

;What people would consider the default language of China, Standard Chinese‚ which English speakers colloquially call Mandarin—was only made official in the nineteen-fifties. （标准汉语是以普通话为基础的，但两者并不相同。）上海话，是我家人在家里说的语言，通常被称为方言。人们普遍存在一种误解，认为普通话和粤语是汉语中仅有的两颗星——而且所有人都说其中之一。 But the history of China is really that of hundreds of languages: Shanghainese and other regional “dialects,” like Fujianese, Hokkien, and Hunanese, are hundreds of years old, have millions of speakers, and developed independently of and even before Standard Chinese, which is based on the dialect of Northern China, where Beijing is situated.

;

;Linguists have tried to draw hard boundaries around what is and isn't a dialect, but nobody can.从语音、清晰度等组成部分来看，许多“方言”与“语言”之间具有相同程度的相似性或差异性。 1945年，社会语言学家马克斯·魏因赖希（Max Weinreich）普及了这样一句话：“语言是一种有陆军和海军的方言。” Which is to say, a “dialect” becomes a language when it is spoken by the people in power.

;
;
;

;During the Qing Dynasty—which lasted, shockingly, until 1911—the imperial language of China was Manchu, a now-endangered language from a region in the northeast that overlaps with modern-day Russia.来自中国南方珠江三角洲广州市的粤语在很多方面都是全球商业早期和进入中国第一阶段的主要语言。 Now, in mainland China, Standard Chinese reigns through the hard mechanism of the modern Chinese state, post-1949, when Beijing was remade as the capital, and its local accent rolled out across the country.

;
;
;

;Shanghainese, which is part of the Wu language group, originating near the Yangtze River, is thousands of years old. （吴语有大约八千万人以汉语为母语，超过意大利语，几乎与德语一样多，使其成为世界上使用最多的母语之一。）在中国，人们仍然与家人和朋友讲当地语言，这是很常见的，而是在学校学习普通话，在电视上听到普通话，在工作中说普通话。中国的卫星电视频道被法律禁止以当地方言播出； ethnic minorities, including the ;Uyghurs;, are made to learn Standard Chinese. In Hong Kong, Cantonese has become a de-facto language of protest, especially during the ;2019 pro-democracy demonstrations;.

;

;Neither Shanghainese nor Standard Chinese is my grandmother's original language;她从小就说着山东话。但在我们家里，我们总是用上海话交谈，这是我母亲的第一语言，桥梁。我的祖母年轻时搬到上海时就知道了这一点。我小时候在悉尼学到的。这无疑是一个确认偏差的例子，但我发现它非常容易讲。它是俚语和柔韧的，不像其他汉语那样有严格的声调结构，并且发音宽容且易于发音。中国有句成语形容上海话听起来多么柔和：人们称之为“吴温柔语”。 Sometimes, to me, it sounds more similar to Korean than to Standard Chinese—the Korean island of Jeju is only three hundred miles away—lower, open vowels, a rapid firing of soft consonants.

;

;Many people my grandmother's age and older struggle to speak Standard Chinese. （全国范围内推动将其作为国语只是在二十世纪中叶才发生，晚于该国采用收音机。）我的祖母可以，但她带着浓重的北方口音，这对许多出生在中国的年轻人来说是这样的人们使它难以理解。她最近给一家健康保险公司打电话。他们在线路上安装了一个翻译器。但像她的地址这样简单的事情听起来却大不相同，以至于译者无法理解。 “对不起，她的口音很重，”翻译对接线员说。 My mother and I have to keep reminding my grandmother to speak ;putonghua;, the Chinese name for Standard Chinese, which means the common tongue.

;

;To say, then, in English, “There he is,” is good—but still incomplete.对我来说，这只奥地利（以及后来的意大利）狗的出现就在上海话中。翻译人员一直面临这个问题：如何将一种语言中的短语的优雅复制到另一种语言中。 In Shanghainese, the fact that ;gou; (“dog”) comes first is perfect. (Articles are rarely used in Chinese.) Linguistically, ;Gou tse leh le; replicates the sensation of how the ;gou tse leh le;. That -;ou; sounds, to me, like the first second of a bark—the dog is there, sticking his nose out before the verb, the preposition. And ;tse leh le; is a figurative coming-out, existing beyond time markers, nothing as stodgy as “he has emerged.” （汉语动词没有时态，更没有过去完成时。） he 是从哪里来的？这有点形而上学——狗是从狗的缺席中出现的。 It's like what you'd say when the curtain rises and the dancers pour out, something more like “voilà!”

;

;I love this—the things formed in the unique nooks of a language.这并不是说英语中不存在“dog”或“come out”这样的词——而是语法本身或词序规则不允许你表达同样的效果。 Roland Kelts once noted in this magazine, on ;the difficulty of translating Haruki Murakami;, that Japanese frequently allows for sentences not to have subjects, giving many of Murakami's lines a wonderful vagueness that is crushed in English; ;Virginia Woolf; once wrote that it is “useless . 。 。 to read Greek in translation,” because “we can never hope to get the whole fling of a sentence” the same.

;

;There are other blunt, beautiful phrases my grandmother says to me, in Shanghainese, that are hard to say to others.她经常说一些话，从骨子里来说，她只爱三个人：我、我的母亲和我的阿姨。我的上海话大多局限于儿时的家庭单音节——问她吃饭了吗，看电视什么，告诉她我爱她。当朋友问起我的祖母如何度过她的日子时，我常常感到有点尴尬地告诉她真相——她正在观看一部用她听不懂的语言讲述狗的电视节目。 I feel even more embarrassed that my grandmother and I, even though we live together and talk every day, are unable to hold a moderately complex conversation.

;

;In April, 2020, early in the ;pandemic;, my grandmother contracted ;COVID;-19.她只得一个人去医院。他们没有为她配备翻译来告诉她发生了什么事以及她要去哪里。他们在电脑中写错了她的名字——中国姓氏和名字的典型混淆——这意味着她在很长一段时间内都无法被搜索到。当我终于接通医院的电话时，我无法正确地告诉她她必须在那里呆多久，或者为什么。我不知道如何表达“信任”，这让我心碎。 ;COVID; was a new disease, and I did not know how to explain it in Chinese, either.最终，一位会说中文的医生告诉她，她的肺部有病。她的症状很轻微，我们不想让她担心。 We were lucky, and she recovered.

;

;People born now in mainland China increasingly do not speak their regional language.到了晚年，生活越来越孤独，我的祖母越来越喜欢上海话。她的中文充满了这种味道；她甚至忘记了自己原来的山东话。我正在学习普通话，但当我和她练习时，她经常听不懂。在某种程度上，这意味着我们两个人虽然无法用更通用的语言进行交流，但拥有一整套我们主要用来互相交谈的语言。 The category of things we both understand—our TV shows, our overlapping Shanghainese—is narrow, but deep.

;

;A few years ago, we took in a dog, a foster greyhound with a sweet disposition.我的祖母很爱他。她经常会像哑剧一样皱着眉头向他和我打招呼，并在打招呼或其他任何事情之前几乎立即告诉我，狗饿了，我应该喂他。当然，无论他上次吃东西是什么时候，这种情况都会发生。 I was surprised to be hit with this full-bore cannon of doting and guilt, a treatment I thought she reserved for my mother, not me.

;
;
;

;My grandmother spoke to the dog in Shanghainese.她直视着他棕色的眼睛，告诉他她爱他。 And, as we scuttled around the house trying to open doors without letting the dog out, we got to say our phrase—;gou tse leh le;—for real this time. ♦

;;School Mission;

;

;The mission of this nightmare school is to challenge students and prepare them for a role in a society in which everything is also terrible. We provide a standards-based curriculum that utilizes data and simmering panic to put you on the path to greater self-knowledge.

;
;

;;Staff Promise;

;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;We, the staff of the school from your nightmares, commit to partnering with parents (and also a random person from your office?) to tap into student potential.与我们的学生会主席密切合作，他——哦，天哪，就是那个演员！ “亲爱的，我把孩子们缩小了”！他现在对你来说似乎异常性感？抢东西？伙计，他是如此轻松地从 Capri Sun 袋中啜饮。瑞克？ Hot damn, Rick Moranis!

;
;

;;Calendar and Curriculum;

;
;
;

;The first day of the school year will be the first day you show up, which is already too late. Anyway, here were the courses:

;
    ;
  • ;AP Triple Calculus
    • ;
  • ;Scoliosis Check
    • ;

    • ;

    • ;

    • ;

    • ;

;;Dress Code;

;

;Student attire should not distract from the learning environment, but let's get this out of the way: you are naked.光着屁股坐在坚硬的塑料座椅上。光着屁股站在冰冷的看台上。 Bare ass against the inside of a ratty mascot costume worn in the view of a smokin' hot crush (role originated by Rick Moranis).

;
;

;;Grading Policy;

;

;Student achievement will be based on mastery of subjects, as determined by Common Core standards and what you suspect your parents really think about your career.

;

;Grades will be weighted as such:

;
    ;
  • ;40%: Participation and classwork
    • ;
  • ;50%: Blurry letters appearing and then disappearing on a sheet of paper
    • ;
  • ;20%: Test you're hearing about for the first time right now
    • ;
  • ;5%: This is bullshit—you have a master's degree!
    • ;
  • ;15%: Hey, the math isn't adding up, but that was never your thing.你很擅长谈论“了不起的盖茨比”。 The green light at the end of the dock!
    • ;
;

;Report cards will be handed out four times a year, and blah, blah, blah—you obviously failed. Now you'll never get into the college you already graduated from!

;
;

;;Homework;

;
;
;

;To regularly assess your progress, daily homework assignments must be completed during an overheated, quick break to kick the covers off. Not completing homework assignments may have an impact on your final grade and your ability to be approved for a mortgage.

;
;

;;Substitutes;

;

;On days when a member of our staff is out sick, we rotate through a roster of highly qualified substitute teachers, including an ex you'd rather die than see and a woman who was once rude to you at Outback Steakhouse.

;
;

;;Attendance Policy;

;

;Excused absences require documentation of one of the following:

;
    ;
  • ;Puking in front of a crush
    • ;
  • ;An altercation with the library bat
    • ;
  • ;Enrollment in a class at the end of an unending hallway
    • ;
;

;Unexcused absences include:

;
    ;
  • ;Waking up to pee
    • ;
  • ;Having a new, pleasant dream
    • ;
;
;

;;School Nurse;

;

;Students may be authorized to visit the school nurse's office when their teeth crumble out of their mouth and scatter like pixie dust, which happens frequently. Students presenting with head lice will have the fact that they are crawling with bugs announced to the entire student body, including Rick Moranis.

;
;

;;Immunization;

;
;
;

;It is the parents' responsibility to provide proof of immunization or else risk you being accosted by your weird uncle who's hanging out by your locker, ranting about the “flaking rash” and “violent twitch” he attributes to his ;COVID;-19 shot.这并不违反任何行为准则。 This is just what you get for browsing Facebook after 10 ;PM;.

;
;

;;Graduation Requirements;

;

  • ;Earn thirty-six required credits
    • ;
  • ;Complete state standardized-test requirements (proctored by a raven)
    • ;
  • ;Complete sessions with a school counsellor (wait, hang on—was therapy free at one point?)
    • ;
  • ;Meet minimum extracurricular hours (try out for part of Nurse in “Romeo and Juliet” only to find out the senior play is “Grease”)
    • ;
  • ;Wake up
    • ;
  • ;Get lost in a corn maze?
    • ;
;
;

;;Repeating Years;

;

;Students seeking to repeat academic years at the school from your nightmares may choose to pop another melatonin. ♦
